Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the mugshots shown are not related to the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, but rather from a labor rights protest in Portland, Oregon.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the mugshots show "all" of the Antifa members who were arrested at the white nationalist rally, when in reality, only four individuals were arrested in connection with the violence at the rally.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to validate the connection between the mugshots and the Antifa members at the Charlottesville rally.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the individuals in the mugshots are Antifa members, even though it is unclear if any of them were specifically connected to an Antifa group.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the individuals in the mugshots were involved in a separate protest in Portland and not related to the Charlottesville rally.
